content.text: table is designed to store information about menu items within a membership-based application. Each record in this table represents a menu item that can be part of a hierarchical menu structure. The table includes details such as the title of the menu item, its position in the hierarchy, associated icons, URLs, and other display-related attributes. The table also supports multi-tiered menu structures and distinguishes between administrative and non-administrative applications.
The complexity level of this table is considered medium due to the following factors:
It involves hierarchical data representation with potential parent-child relationships.
It includes multiple nullable fields and a mix of data types.
It has a foreign key relationship with another table, indicating a dependency.
The presence of multiple attributes related to UI/UX and functionality adds to its complexity.

This table is used in applications where dynamic menu structures are required, such as content management systems, administrative dashboards, or user portals. Use cases include:
Rendering navigation menus based on user roles or permissions.
Supporting multi-level menus for complex applications.
Differentiating between administrative and user-facing menu items.
Customizing menu appearance and behavior based on application context.
